gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC; National Coastal Data Development Center

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata: Extensions for Remote Sensing Metadata

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Sea surface temperature and history derived from an analysis of MODIS Level 3 data for the Gulf of Mexico

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Naval Research Laboratory, Stennis Space Center

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This dataset consists of measurements from ocean color sensors and the blending of products for ocean color sensors for several products derived from the Quasi-Analytical Algorithm including absorption, backward scattering, and absorption due to CDOM and phytoplankton, and the extracted color images. In addition to these products, sea surface temperature and chlorophyll from NASA algorithms were produced. For further information on how these products were generated, please contact Robert Arnone at the Naval Research Lab ph. (228) 688-5268. E-mail: arnone@nrlssc.navy.mil

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To supply the most recent optical products for the Gulf of Mexico for real-time monitoring.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: This product is the result of ongoing NRL research. Use Constraints: None Distribution Liability: NOAA makes no warranty regarding these data, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty. NOAA, NESDIS, NODC and NCDDC cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in these data, nor as a result of the failure of these data to function on a particular system.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Native Dataset Environment: APS v3.4.3 i686-pc-linux-gnu

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NOAA's National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC)

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: The classification scheme comprehensively includes all anticipated land covers, however, not all pixels will contain data due to cloud cover for the past seven days.
The classification scheme comprehensively includes all anticipated land covers, however, not all pixels will contain data due to cloud cover for the past seven days.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: LPC's (Latest Pixel Composites) are processed through NRL's Automated Processing System in real-time. LPC's are the most recent clear pixel using a time scale of seven days and the multiple ocean color sensors are blended using a weighted average. The optical algorithms used were Quasi-Analytical Algorithms (QAA). The chlorophyll product was derived by using NASA's algorithm.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Blended Products from Ocean Color Sensors

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: data was collected from this device

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: This metadata was automatically generated from the FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata standard version FGDC-STD-001-1998 .

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC; National Coastal Data Development Center
